resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: [Packaging] Script like verify-release-candidate.sh for automated testing of conda and wheel Python packages in ASF dist

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
wesm commented on pull request #5748: ARROW-7014: [Developer][Release] Add "wheels" verification option to verify-release-candidate.sh for Linux and macOS
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5748
 
 
   Creates temporary conda environments to install and check the wheels. Checking within virtualenv would be more work but give us a stronger guarantee that things are working, but this will help catch obvious brokenness / corruption
   
   My bash fu is not strong enough to conditionally check whether Flight or Gandiva are working on Python 3 wheels, maybe someone can help me.
   
   For 0.15.1 rc0 this passes on Linux but fails on macOS because of the issue I cited in the vote thread.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on pull request #5748: ARROW-7014: [Developer][Release] Add "wheels" verification option to verify-release-candidate.sh for Linux and macOS
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5748#discussion_r340126498
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/release/verify-release-candidate.sh
 ##########
 @@ -531,6 +534,77 @@ test_binary_distribution() {
   fi
 }
 
+test_linux_wheels() {
+  local py_arches="2.7mu 3.6m 3.7m"
+
+  for py_arch in ${py_arches}; do
+    local env=_verify_wheel-${py_arch}
+    conda create -yq -n ${env} python=${py_arch//[mu]/}
+    conda activate ${env}
+
+    pip install python-rc/${VERSION}-rc${RC_NUMBER}/pyarrow-${VERSION}-cp${py_arch//[mu.]/}-cp${py_arch//./}-manylinux1_x86_64.whl
+
+    python -c "import pyarrow.parquet"
+    python -c "import pyarrow.plasma"
+    python -c "import pyarrow.fs"
+
+    pip install python-rc/${VERSION}-rc${RC_NUMBER}/pyarrow-${VERSION}-cp${py_arch//[mu.]/}-cp${py_arch//./}-manylinux2010_x86_64.whl
+
+    python -c "import pyarrow.parquet"
+    python -c "import pyarrow.plasma"
+    python -c "import pyarrow.fs"
+
 
 Review comment:
   You should deactivate the conda env to avoid tainting further invocations (especially for the last pass).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on pull request #5748: ARROW-7014: [Developer][Release] Add "wheels" verification option to verify-release-candidate.sh for Linux and macOS
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5748#discussion_r340155207
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/release/verify-release-candidate.sh
 ##########
 @@ -99,14 +100,7 @@ fetch_archive() {
   shasum -a 512 -c ${dist_name}.tar.gz.sha512
 }
 
-test_binary() {
-  local download_dir=binaries
-  mkdir -p ${download_dir}
-
-  python3 $SOURCE_DIR/download_rc_binaries.py $VERSION $RC_NUMBER --dest=${download_dir}
-
-  pushd ${download_dir}
-
+verify_cwd_artifact_signatures() {
 
 Review comment:
   The refactor make this function side effect free. Does it need to be cwd, can it just take the path as input?

fsaintjacques commented on pull request #5748: ARROW-7014: [Developer][Release] Add "wheels" verification option to verify-release-candidate.sh for Linux and macOS
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5748#discussion_r340155415
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/release/verify-release-candidate.sh
 ##########
 @@ -531,6 +534,77 @@ test_binary_distribution() {
   fi
 }
 
+test_linux_wheels() {
+  local py_arches="2.7mu 3.6m 3.7m"
+
+  for py_arch in ${py_arches}; do
+    local env=_verify_wheel-${py_arch}
+    conda create -yq -n ${env} python=${py_arch//[mu]/}
+    conda activate ${env}
+
+    pip install python-rc/${VERSION}-rc${RC_NUMBER}/pyarrow-${VERSION}-cp${py_arch//[mu.]/}-cp${py_arch//./}-manylinux1_x86_64.whl
+
+    python -c "import pyarrow.parquet"
+    python -c "import pyarrow.plasma"
+    python -c "import pyarrow.fs"
+
+    pip install python-rc/${VERSION}-rc${RC_NUMBER}/pyarrow-${VERSION}-cp${py_arch//[mu.]/}-cp${py_arch//./}-manylinux2010_x86_64.whl
+
+    python -c "import pyarrow.parquet"
+    python -c "import pyarrow.plasma"
+    python -c "import pyarrow.fs"
+
+    # TODO check Flight only for Python 3
+  done
+}
+
+test_macos_wheels() {
+  local py_arches="2.7m 3.6m 3.7m"
+
+  for py_arch in ${py_arches}; do
+    local env=_verify_wheel-${py_arch}
+    conda create -yq -n ${env} python=${py_arch//m/}
+    conda activate ${env}
+
+    pip install python-rc/${VERSION}-rc${RC_NUMBER}/pyarrow-${VERSION}-cp${py_arch//[m.]/}-cp${py_arch//./}-macosx_10_6_intel.whl
+
+    python -c "import pyarrow.parquet"
+    python -c "import pyarrow.plasma"
+    python -c "import pyarrow.fs"
+
+    # TODO check Flight only for Python 3

   Ditto with deactivate.

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.

fields.description: Facilitate testing RC wheels. Also test checksum and sig
fields.summary: [Developer] Write script to verify Linux wheels given local environment with conda or virtualenv
